intro: Bossiaea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, angular stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers in late winter to early spring, which are followed by small, bead-like fruits. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as heaths and woodlands. Bossiaea angustifolia is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions.
